page.title: 15Ampleforth Schola Cantorum.
page.content: The Ampleforth Schola Cantorum sing Church Music at Abbey services on Fridays and Sundays during term time. They rehearse on Wednesdays and before each service. The choir is made up of boys and Monks from the college. The trebles come from Junior House. The majority of pieces are accompanied on an organ and conducted by the Director of Music. Concerts are held regularly in the Abbey and other Cathedrals, churches or colleges. The Schola has made a number of European tours. The Schola wear red cassocks for services and most concerts. There are two Head Choristers chosen by the Director of Music each year for their singing ability. They then choose their Deputies.
